thread.title: Cubs Game Day: Counting on Arrieta in NLCS Game 2
thread.title_full: Cubs Game Day: Counting on Arrieta in NLCS Game 2 - Chicago Tribune

author: Colleen Kane
title: Cubs Game Day: Counting on Arrieta in NLCS Game 2
text:
Right-hander Jake Arrieta takes the mound Sunday night at Citi Field to try to help the Cubs even the National League Championship Series against the Mets.
Arrieta has gone 2-0 with a 2.45 ERA over 14 2/3 innings in two postseason starts this year, and the Cubs need more of the same from him.
Cubs manager Joe Maddon said “nobody’s seen” a second half as good as Arrieta’s has been.
“To watch this on an everyday basis, it’s almost unreal sometimes,” Maddon said. “It’s been going on for a couple of months. … Really good hitters are uncomfortable.”
The Cubs lost the series opener 4-2 on a chilly Saturday, and they face more cold conditions Sunday against Mets rookie right-hander Noah Syndergaard.
Syndergaard is 0-1 with a 3.68 ERA over one start and one relief appearance in this year’s playoffs.
Chris Coghlan, who homered in Syndergaard’s major-league debut May 12, will start in right field in place of Jorge Soler and will bat sixth. Maddon said the move is in part because of Coghlan’s early success against him but also because he wants to get Coghlan playing time.
“I need to keep him solvent,” Maddon said. “I need to keep him out there a little bit. Jorge has done a nice job, obviously. He's done a wonderful job, and Jorge will be back out there. But you ask these guys to pinch hit or come off the bench or play, and if you don't give them an opportunity to play, why would I expect a good result when you ask him to come off the bench?”
